title: Thunderlord's shouldnt proc on a single ability cast.
body:
I've been playing a lot of the Donger recently, with a lot of success.. maybe too much success...

Donger has always been great in solo queue due to how well he punishes sloppy engages(which, in solo queue is every engage), but thunderlord's on him seems almost abusive. It is possible to proc thunderlords's with a single W cast, as long as at least 3 rockets hit the target, making his early poke hit extremely hard even with only 1 point in the ability.

My understanding of thunderlord's is that it is meant to complement combo casters and assassins who rapidly use a full rotation of spells on one target. Right now it complements almost  _everything_ due to how easy it is to proc on nearly every champ. I even saw a {{champion:75}} using it, who was perfectly able to proc thunderlord's with a single spiritfire, as long as I took 3 ticks of damage from it.

Seems like common sense that thunderlord's should only get one stack with any given ability cast, even if the ability can hit multiple times. This would at least help push it back into its niche of combo casters, rather than being a practical pick on everything.

This thread's complaining about the wrong example.
Akali's is okay, since she's damaging with the mark that's in the kit to substitute the damage-less W. At least it doesn't also counter her passive's on-hit as another attack.

The real issues are DoT and AoE effects. Gangplank's R, Miss Fortune's E, Malzahar's W and E, Rumble's Q, Morgana's W, Wukong's ultimate, etc. can proc Thunderlord's on a single cast. All abilities that require no extra effort to get 3 hits, whereas Akali actually has to walk up and attack. I assume this person wouldn't be complaining about the problem at all if Akali's cloud did even 1 damage.

Dots and poisons won't proc it. It procs on every new damaging effect but not debuffs from dots. So things like Fiddle W and Karma W will proc it in 0.75s since they tick 4 times per second and apply a new damaging effect every time while dots won't as they're tied to a debuff and only count as 1 stack.

Though if you have a dot tied to another damage source it will count as 2 stacks(Teemo can Q-AA for the proc for example).
Teemo cannot proc it with just Q+AA until Luden's Echo.
